tasks.task: Planting and managing chili pepper crop.
subtasks: Acquire chili pepper seeds.
Choose appropriate fertilizer (e.g., cowdung, Jazzy figuras).
Prepare seedlings in a nursery.
Transplant seedlings to the field.
Apply proper irrigation during dry season.
Prune trees to facilitate flowering.
Apply flower stimulants or fertilizer for better fruiting.
Manage farm rotation or intercropping if necessary.
Hand-pollinate flowers manually if needed.
Test soil pH and nutrient levels.
Apply lime to adjust pH if necessary.
Integrate organic matter (e.g., compost, manure) into the soil.
Implement crop rotation to prevent nutrient depletion.
Monitor soil moisture levels and adjust irrigation accordingly.
Identify common pests (e.g., aphids, spider mites) and diseases (e.g., leaf spot, blossom end rot).
Implement integrated pest management practices (e.g., biological control, cultural practices).
Apply chemical pesticides or fungicides as needed.
Monitor for nematode infestations and manage accordingly.
Determine optimal harvest time based on fruit color and size.
Harvest chili peppers by hand, ensuring proper handling.
Sort and grade harvested peppers for market.
Package and store fresh chili peppers in cool, ventilated areas.
Process excess chili peppers into powder for future sales.

tasks.task: Dealing with government and market access.
subtasks: Establish a business relationship with government agencies for seed and fertilizer distribution.
Explore processing methods to add value to chili peppers.
Network with other farmers to form cooperatives for collective marketing.
Attend agricultural fairs or events to showcase products.
Conduct farmer-to-farmer workshops on chili pepper farming techniques.
Participate in radio and television programs to share experiences.
Collaborate with NGOs for technology transfer and capacity building.

tasks.task: Cooking and utilizing chili peppers in the kitchen.
subtasks: Cook chili pepper-based meals (e.g., stews, soups, a la carte dishes).
Experiment with different spicing techniques (e.g., drying, smoking).
Incorporate chili peppers into traditional Ghanaian dishes.
Develop new recipes using chili peppers as a main ingredient.
